author: IfYouPlayThisGameBackwardsShow

text: I have found that this music is very nostalgic, and also the bane of my existence. I remember there was a particular town that had this music, but there was something I had to do. sadly, I had no clue what to do. I spent hours and days trying to find out what to do there. I quit the game for about 4-5 years then decided to play it again. But, strangely, even with all the anguish with this track, I still find it to be calming than before...good times :)
author: Locke554

text: Not really a series I like, but it definitely has some amazing music.

text: What an innocent song... this song brings me back to my childhood.
author: McRomes

text: @calvinsora101 Also, the translation is a bit love-it-or-hate-it thing. For me, I loved it though there was a puzzle which was almost impossible without going through a walkthrough but most if them are pretty understandable. Also, yes the puzzles, all mazes have them and they're really interesting. I don't know what else to say, I don'w want to overbuy it to you, but yes it did contribute a large part to my childhood so this game is dear to me and I believe to others as well.
author: PrinceMerluza

text: @calvinsora101 If you ask me, it depends on the person. First of all, obviously you should like turn-based RPG games. Secondly, WA2 is by far, in a sense, the most mature of the WA series. The story, plot, etc.. Of course the ultimatum, is that it's go save the world thing, but the flow is magnificently weaved that it allows for plot/twists I've never again seen in similar rpgs. It's very different from WA1, and I think that's why it gained a rather negative reputation.
author: PrinceMerluza

text:
Always thought the Wild Arms soundtracks by Miss Naruke didn't get the credit they deserved. But not by SupraD, which is a good thing ;)
